law.catch_line: There is a Strategic Energy Investment Advisory Board....

text.section: There is a Strategic Energy Investment Advisory Board.

section.section: The Board shall review the Program and the Administration's proposed uses of and expenditures from the Fund and make recommendations to the Administration concerning any proposed use or expenditure.
The Administration shall consider the Board's recommendations when making decisions about uses and expenditures from the Fund.

text.section:
If a regulated lobbyist is appointed to serve as a member of the Board, the lobbyist:
is not subject to § 15-504(d) of this article with respect to that service; and
is not subject to § 15-703(f)(3) of this article as a result of that service.

section.section: The term of a member appointed by the Governor is 3 years.
The terms of the members appointed by the Governor are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on June 1, 2008.
The Board shall meet at least 2 times each year.
The Board may act only by the affirmative vote of at least six voting members.

A member of the Board:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Board; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

text.section: The Administration shall provide staff support for the Board.
